attractions.name: Sankore Mosque
attractions.description: One of three ancient mosques of Timbuktu, built in the 14th century and center of the historic University of Timbuktu.

attractions.name: Djinguereber Mosque
attractions.description: Built in 1327, this mosque is a famous learning center and one of Timbuktu's most recognizable landmarks.

attractions.name: Ahmed Baba Institute
attractions.description: Houses thousands of manuscripts from Timbuktu's golden age, showcasing Africa's rich intellectual history.

attractions.name: Timbuktu Manuscripts
attractions.description: Ancient scholarly texts covering topics from astronomy to medicine, dating back to the 13th century.

attractions.name: Tomb of Askia
attractions.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this 15th century pyramidal tomb is a fine example of Sudano-Sahelian architecture.

attractions.name: Timbuktu Market
attractions.description: Vibrant local market offering traditional crafts, spices, and goods from across the Sahara.

attractions.name: Sahara Desert Tours
attractions.description: Experience camel treks and overnight stays in the majestic Sahara Desert surrounding Timbuktu.

attractions.name: Festival au Désert
attractions.description: Annual music festival celebrating Tuareg culture with traditional and contemporary desert blues music.
